meanings.definition: A person who is excessively proper or prim in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The new girl at school is such a priss, always wearing fancy dresses and speaking politely.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother can be a bit of a priss, insisting on proper etiquette at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: The priss in the office always arranges her desk meticulously, even color-coding her pens.
meanings.sent4: She was a real priss about grammar, correcting everyone's speech with a disapproving look.
meanings.sent5: The character in the book was described as a priss, always concerned with following the rules to the letter.

meanings.definition: To behave in a finicky or fussy manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't priss over the details; just get the job done.
meanings.sent2: She tends to priss over her appearance, spending hours getting ready.
meanings.sent3: He prissed around the kitchen, rearranging the spices in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent4: Stop prissing about and make a decision already!
meanings.sent5: The cat prissed around the room, carefully avoiding any obstacles in its path.
